Job Title: Safety Manager

Location: Buffalo, NY

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
The State Group’s family of companies is experiencing exponential growth through investing in our people, innovation, and technology. Since 1961, our 3000+ professionals in North America have provided comprehensive multi-trade industrial contracting services that include Electrical, Mechanical, and Civil on a single-source basis. We have tremendous opportunities for driven leaders looking for a high-energy career.
The State Group is seeking a Safety Manager to lead the safety function in Buffalo, NY, and the surrounding region.
BENEFITS OF WORKING WITH USThis position is an integral part of our success and provides opportunities for career advancement.Company vehicle and gas card for all work-related travel.100% PAID medical, dental, and vision insurance.Paid time off is provided for vacation, sick days, and holidays.401(k) Retirement Plan with company match and immediate vesting.Competitive Compensation, annual pay increases, and bonuses.State embraces and encourages workplace diversity.
WHAT YOU WILL DOPromote a positive and proactive safety culture through behaviors and actions.Review and update written programs, audits, and accident investigations.Track incident metrics and trends and apply findings.Manage worker’s compensation incidents in a confidential manner that meets the needs of the employee and the company.Communicate and collaborate with business partners, regulatory agencies, and employees regarding safety requirements and opportunities.Ensure compliance with all regulatory bodies and standards.Communicate issues, trends, regulatory updates, and training materials to employees, leadership, and direct reports.Responsible for the development and performance management of direct reports.
WHAT YOU NEED TO JOIN OUR TEAM7+ years of safety experience including 3+ years of direct supervisory experience.A bachelor's degree in safety or a related field, or equivalent experience.Broad and detailed regulatory, training, inspection, and auditing knowledge.Construction or manufacturing industry experience is required.Basic knowledge of compliance relating to DOT, MSHA and other federal regulations is preferred.Ability to manage priorities, and strong time management and organizational skills.Ability to professionally manage a fast-paced environment.Demonstrate professionalism and conduct that sets an example of the core values of the organization.Ability to communicate with and present information to senior leaders and customers.Willingness to work overtime as needed during periods of shutdown or peak activity.
The salary offered will be dependent on experience and qualifications.
To learn more about The State Group, visit our website at stategroup.comThe State Group is committed to the full inclusion of all qualified individuals and is an Equal Opportunity Employer.Reasonable accommodations are available upon request for applicants with disabilities who are participating in the employment process.

Experience Level (if available): None
